title: ISic000396. I.Sicily inscription 000396
body:
1Crescentiae bene m[e]renti
2in pace <quae> vixit ann(is)
3p(lus) m(i)n(us) L deposit(a) III Kal(endas)
4Decemb(res) F̣ḷ(avio) Ṣṭịḷịc̣ọ-
5ne cons(ule) se vivi conpa[ra-]
6[v]er[u]n[t]

l.2 quae

1CRESCENTIAEBENEM[.]RENTI
2INPACEQUEVIXITANN
3PMNLDEPOSITIIIKAL
4DECEMB.........
5NECONSSEVIVICONPA[..]
6[.]ER[.]N[.]

l.2 quae

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of CIL, amended by Ferrua;
  • 4: Amico read a confused sequence of letters after DECEMB, and conjectured FL.STILICO, and Ferrua concurs; Mommsen instead proposed FL.OPILIO

English translation

commentary

If Mommsen's reading of line 4 is accepted, the date is either 453 or 521 CE. Ferrua notes that Stilicho was also consul II in 405, but the absence of indication of iteration leads him to prefer 400 CE.

bibliography

  • 10.7115 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 3735 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000357
  • Ferrua 1982-1983 10 no.23 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001996
